elements.label: Hunger
elements.description: I need rest and nourishment, if I am to recover. But when my mouth waters, when my vision swims, I see the red cup; and now and then it will speak to me. [Dreaming with Hunger before the card fades will allow you to recover Health.]

elements.label: Health
elements.description: This is my body. There are other bodies, but this one is mine, and my mind needs it as a fungus needs soil. [With enough Vitality, you can gain more Health.]

elements.label: Vitality

slots.label: More Vitality
slots.description: With enough Vitality - or sometimes something more exotic - I can increase my Health.

elements.description: Exercise, or something rarer, has invigorated me. [Use with another Vitality to improve your abilities. It lasts only three minutes, if unused.]

elements.label: Vitality: a Lesson Learnt
elements.description: I am ready to improve. [Use this with your Strength skill to improve the skill and gain Health. It lasts up to five minutes before it decays back to a Vitality.]

elements.label: Restlessness
elements.description: A restless longing has me. I feel that I want to do... something. What, exactly?

elements.label: Bloodshed
elements.description: Blood has been spilt.

elements.label: An Injury

slots.label: Medicines, or...
slots.description: I could pay for a doctor's visit...

slots.label: ...Vitality
slots.description: ...but perhaps I just need a little rest.

elements.description: I need rest and nourishment, if I am to recover. But the Mother of Ants looks kindly on wounds. [Dreaming with an Injury before the card fades will also allow you to recover Health.]

elements.label: Passion (Disillusioned)
elements.description: I have gone against my own principles, or my own preferences. [This card can't be used, but it will recover after sixty seconds.]

elements.label: Passion (Exhausted)
elements.description: My passions burn low. [This card can't be used, but it will recover after sixty seconds.]

elements.label: Health (Fatigued)
elements.description: This card can't be used, but it will recover after sixty seconds. I can recover it faster by Dreaming.

elements.label: An Affliction

slots.label: Medicines, or...
slots.description: I could pay for a doctor's visit...

slots.label: ...Vitality
slots.description: ...but perhaps I just need a little rest.

elements.description: Disease has left me weak. I need rest and nourishment, if I am to recover. [Dream on an Affliction to transform it back to Health, before the card decays.]

elements.label: Reason
elements.description:
'No live organism can continue for long to exist sanely under conditions of absolute reality.' - Shirley Jackson

[With Erudition, you can Study to gain more Reason.]

elements.label: Reason [Dimmed]
elements.description:
My mind is weary. [This card can't be used, but it will recover after 

sixty seconds.]

elements.label: Erudition

slots.label: More Erudition
slots.description: With enough Erudition - or sometimes something more exotic -  I can increase my Reason.

elements.description: I soak up knowledge as a shadow soaks up light. I may be close to advancement. [Erudition can be used with Study to gain Reason. It lasts only three minutes, if unused.]

elements.label: Erudition: a Lesson Learnt
elements.description: I am ready to improve. [Use this with your Scholarship skill to improve the skill and gain Reason. It lasts up to five minutes before it decays back to an Erudition.]

elements.label: Dread

slots.label: Reminders
slots.description: I need a little peace, or a moment of happiness. [Too much Dread will destroy you. Contentment can cure it.]

slots.label: With
slots.description: Perhaps I can use my Dread to strengthen a dangerous influence.

slots.label: Knowledge
slots.description: I must understand the influences at work, if I am to strengthen or to subvert them. [You'll need a significant grounding in the relevant lore.]

elements.description: I've seen too much. A nameless gnawing fear has its teeth in my hopes; an existential horror.

elements.label: Passion
elements.description:
'Dull minds are never either intuitive or mathematical.' - Blaise Pascal

[With enough Glimmering, you can Study to gain more Passion.]

elements.label: Decrepitude
elements.description: Some wounds never quite heal. [Untreated Injuries and Hunger become Decrepitude, which does not return to Health. Decrepitude remains until you die.]

elements.label: Glimmering

slots.label: More Glimmering
slots.description: With enough Glimmering - or sometimes something more exotic - I can increase my Passion.

elements.description: My emotions run higher than usual. There are things I'll never understand, and those things will always be precious, but just now I am closer to them. [Glimmering can be used with Study to gain Passion. It lasts only three minutes, if unused.]

elements.label: Glimmering: a Lesson Learnt
elements.description: I am ready to improve. [Use this with your Imagination skill to improve the skill and gain Passion. It lasts up to five minutes before it decays back to a Glimmering.]

elements.label: Fascination

slots.label: Reminders
slots.description: Grey reality will steady my soul.

slots.label: With
slots.description: Perhaps I can use my Fascination to strengthen a tempting influence.

slots.label: Knowledge
slots.description: I must understand the influences at work, if I am to strengthen or to subvert them. [You'll need a significant grounding in the relevant lore.]

elements.description: Light LEAKS through the CRACKS. My mind is BRIGHTER than it EVER was. THE HIGHER I RISE THE MORE I SEE.

elements.label: Scholar: Latin
elements.description: A dead language: dead as diamonds. [Some books must be translated before they can be read.]

elements.label: Scholar: Fucine
elements.description: A people lived east of the lost lake Fucino. Horace warned that theirs was the land of witches. This was their language, called by some 'the dry tongue' and by others 'the tongue of witches'.[Some books must be translated before they can be read.]

elements.label: Scholar: Greek
elements.description: No doubt you're conversant with every variety of Greek, from the beginning to Byzantium. But it's a good thing you have those reference works. [Some books must be translated before they can be read.]

elements.label: Scholar: Phrygian
elements.description: The Phrygians worshipped the Great Mother, who we call the Grail. Theirs was the land in which the Sisterhood of the Knot was born, and this is the tongue in which the Thunderskin pleaded, at his ascension. [Some books must be translated before they can be read.]

elements.label: Scholar: Aramaic
elements.description: The language of Aram, and all her many children these three thousand years and more. [Some books must be translated before they can be read.]

elements.label: Scholar: Deep Mandaic
elements.description: The most secret script of the innermost rites of the deep sects of the deep desert. The birth-tongue, it is claimed, of the Mother of Ants herself. [Some books must be translated before they can be read.]

elements.label: Scholar: Sanskrit
elements.description: The holy tongue of the Subcontinent. The door to four thousand years of poetry, ceremony and mystery now opens before you, if you can struggle through the lotus convolutions of its vocabulary. [Some books must be translated before they can be read.]

elements.label: Scholar: Vak
elements.description: Before gods arose from blood, before ever ape stood upright, this was the language heard in the House of the Sun. [Some books must be translated before they can be read.]

elements.label: Fleeting Reminiscence
elements.description: A moment in time. In another moment, it'll be gone.

slots.label: With
slots.description: Perhaps I can find something in my memories to strengthen a transient influence.

slots.label: Knowledge
slots.description: I must understand the influences at work, if I am to strengthen or to subvert them. [You'll need a significant grounding in the relevant lore.]

elements.label: Contentment
elements.description: I'm happy, I think. [Contentment defends against Dread; but Contentment doesn't last.]

slots.label: With
slots.description: Perhaps I can use my Contentment to strengthen a positive influence.

slots.label: Knowledge
slots.description: I must understand the influences at work, if I am to strengthen or to subvert them. [You'll need a significant grounding in the relevant lore.]

elements.label: Scar: Brutal Experience
elements.description: FAUSTUS: I think Hell's a fable. MEPHISTOPHILIS: Ay, think so still, till experience change thy mind. [You've made a permanent sacrifice for power.]

elements.label: Scar: Half-Healed Fistula
elements.description: Not all doors are wounds; but all wounds are doors. [You've made a permanent sacrifice for power.]

elements.label: Scar: Old Wound
elements.description: Step closer to the sunset, and see the first stars of night. [You've made a permanent sacrifice for power.]

elements.label: Scar: A Wandering Heart
elements.description: I have so much life in me. It is difficult not to move. When I sit, my joints burn. I know that if I stop, I might stop for always. [You've made a permanent sacrifice for power. Be careful: unlike Health, this card will not satisfy Sickness or Starvation.]

elements.label: Scar: A Wandering Heart (Strained)
elements.description: My arteries sing, my veins burn. I cannot push myself any further. [Wait.]

elements.label: Scar: A Flexible Aspect
elements.description: I've worn so many guises. With each new guise it is harder to recall my original face. Even the cartilage softens when my tempers are high. [You've made a permanent sacrifice for power.]

elements.label: Scar: A Flexible Aspect (Strained)
elements.description: With each new expression my features ripple like water. If I am not careful I shall entirely dissolve. [Wait.]

elements.label: Scar: A Translucency
elements.description: Sometimes now I am beautiful beneath my skin. When I bend to the right angle - when my garments falls aside - when the eye is keen - my shape is a perfect revelation. [You've made a permanent sacrifice for power.]
